intro: Equisetum myriochaetum, commonly known as the slender horsetail, is a perennial plant belonging to the Equisetaceae family. It is characterized by its jointed, hollow stems covered in small, backward-facing prickles. The plant produces spore-bearing cones at the base of its stems, which are typically found in moist, nutrient-rich soils. It thrives in wetlands, stream banks, and other aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats. Equisetum myriochaetum is an ancient plant with a lineage dating back to the Paleozoic era.
